title: Data Science
description: Step into the world of high-paying Data Science careers with confidence. This course equips you with practical skills, hands-on projects, and industry-ready knowledge from Python and SQL to Machine Learning, AI, and Power BI dashboards. Beyond coding, gain career support with resume building, LinkedIn optimization, and job guidance. Learn by doing, solve real-world problems, and showcase portfolio-ready projects. Perfect for students aiming to upskill fast, stand out to recruiters, and land their dream role in data-driven industries.
outcomes: Learn Python for data science basics
Build Machine Learning models (Regression, Classification, Clustering)

curriculum.title: Module 1 - Python Foundations for Data Science
curriculum.content:
• Python for Data Science: Overview & Setup
• Variables, Data Types & Type Casting
• Strings, Lists, Tuples, Sets & Dictionaries
• Conditional Statements & Loops
• Functions in Python - Definition & Usage
• Mini Exercises: loops, conditions, functions, file operations
• Hands-On Practice (Solve Python coding exercises)

curriculum.title: Module 2 - Data Analysis & Visualization (Pandas + EDA)
curriculum.content:
• Getting Started with Pandas,
• Core Data Structures: Series & DataFrames
• Creating, Modifying, Selecting & Filtering DataFrames
• Data Cleaning, Preprocessing & Transformation
• Grouping, Merging & Joining DataFrames
• Working with CSV & Excel Files
• Exploratory Data Analysis (Univariate & Bivariate)
• Data Visualization with Matplotlib & Seaborn
• Hands-On Practice (Analyze real-world datasets, Generate insights and visualizations, Python Project: Automate Data Cleaning & Preprocessing)

curriculum.title: Module 3 - Statistics for Data Science
curriculum.content:
• Descriptive Statistics: Central Tendency
• Correlation & Covariance Analysis
• Hypothesis Testing: Z-test, T-test, Chi-Square
• Confidence Intervals & P-values
• Statistics Case Study: Real-world dataset analysis
• Mini Exercises: Applying statistics to solve problems
• Hands-On Practice (Apply statistical concepts on datasets)

curriculum.title: Module 4 - SQL for Data Science
curriculum.content:
Introduction to Databases & SQL
• SELECT Statements & Filtering Data
• Aggregations: COUNT, SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX
• GROUP BY & HAVING Clauses
• Joins: INNER, LEFT, RIGHT, FULL
• Subqueries & Common Table Expressions (CTEs)
• SQL Case Study: Data Insights
• Hands-On Practice (Query datasets to extract insights,Perform joins, aggregations, and subqueries)

curriculum.title: Module 5 - Machine Learning Foundations
curriculum.content:
• Introduction to Machine Learning: Supervised & Unsupervised
• Regression: Linear, Decision Tree, Random Forest
• Classification: Logistic, Decision Tree, Random Forest
• Unsupervised Learning: K-Means Clustering
• Hands-On Practice (Build and evaluate regression & classification models, Explore clustering)
• Case Study: Customer dataset analysis

curriculum.title: Module 6 - Feature Engineering & AI / Deep Learning Essentials
curriculum.content:
• Feature Selection, Scaling & Normalization
• Encoding Categorical Features
• Dimensionality Reduction Basics (PCA)
• Neural Networks & Deep Learning:
• Introduction to Neural Networks & Perceptrons
• Activation Functions: Sigmoid, ReLU, Tanh
• Forward & Backward Propagation Concepts
• Hands-On: Train a Neural Network on MNIST
• NLP, Large Language Models & AI:
• Introduction to NLP & Applications
• Large Language Models (LLMs): Concepts & Use Cases
• Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Overview

curriculum.title: Module 7 - Data Storytelling & Power BI
curriculum.content:
• Data Storytelling Framework: Findings → Impact → Recommendation
• Power BI: Connecting Data, Models & Visualizations
• Interactive Dashboards: Filters, Slicers & Drill-Through Techniques
• DAX Basics for Calculations
• Portfolio Preparation: Showcasing Projects
• Career Launchpad: Resume Building & Interview Preparation
• Hands-On Practice (Build interactive dashboards, Prepare story-driven visualizations for portfolio)

curriculum.title: Module 8 - Capstone Projects
curriculum.content:
• Python Project: Automate Data Cleaning & Preprocessing
• SQL Project: Data Insights Dashboard
• ML Project 1: Customer Churn Prediction (Classification)
• ML Project 2: House Price Prediction (Regression)
• AI Project: RAG-based Question Answering Chatbot
• Power BI Project: Interactive Sales Dashboard
• Hands-On Practice (Implement full workflow from dataset to insights, Showcase projects in portfolio-ready format)

inclusions: Job search guidance & mock interview prep
requirements: No prior experience in data science is needed
Basic computer skills and internet access
Willingness to learn and solve real-world problems
Curiosity and consistency — that's all you really need!
Stable internet connection for accessing course content
Basic familiarity with using the terminal/command line (helpful but not required)

title: Data Analytics
description: Unlock your potential in the world of data with our comprehensive Data Analytics course. Gain hands-on experience with Python, R, SQL, Machine Learning, and Power BI while analyzing real-world datasets. Learn to clean, visualize, and interpret data effectively, and build a portfolio that impresses recruiters. Beyond technical skills, get career support, resume guidance, and LinkedIn optimization to land your dream role. Ideal for students who want to upskill quickly, solve practical problems, and excel in today's competitive, data-driven job market.
outcomes: Master Python & R programming for data analysis and visualization
Clean, preprocess, and analyze datasets using Pandas, SQL, and R
Perform Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) and extract actionable insights
Apply statistics, hypothesis testing, and interpret real-world data
Build and evaluate Machine Learning models: regression, classification, clustering
Create interactive dashboards and data stories using Power BI
Complete capstone projects to showcase a professional portfolio
Gain career support: resume building, LinkedIn makeover, and job search guidance

curriculum.title: Module 1 - Python Foundations for Data Analytics
curriculum.content:
• Python for Data Analytics: Overview & Setup
• Variables, Data Types & Type Casting
• Strings, Lists, Tuples, Sets & Dictionaries
• Conditional Statements & Loops
• Functions in Python - Definition & Usage
• Mini Exercises: loops, conditions, functions, file operations
• Hands-On Practice (Solve Python coding exercises)

curriculum.title: Module 2 - Data Analysis & Visualization (Pandas + EDA)
curriculum.content:
• Getting Started with Pandas,
• Core Data Structures: Series & DataFrames
• Creating, Modifying, Selecting & Filtering DataFrames
• Data Cleaning, Preprocessing & Transformation
• Grouping, Merging & Joining DataFrames
• Working with CSV & Excel Files
• Exploratory Data Analysis (Univariate & Bivariate)
• Data Visualization with Matplotlib & Seaborn
• Hands-On Practice (Analyze real-world datasets - Generate insights and visualizations, Project: EDA project)

curriculum.title: Module 3 - Statistics for Data Analytics
curriculum.content:
• Descriptive Statistics: Central Tendency
• Correlation & Covariance Analysis
• Hypothesis Testing: Z-test, T-test, Chi-Square
• Confidence Intervals & P-values
• Statistics Case Study: Real-world dataset analysis
• Hands-On Practice (Apply statistical concepts on datasets, Perform hypothesis testing and interpret results)

curriculum.title: Module 4 - SQL for Data Analytics
curriculum.content:
Introduction to Databases & SQL
• SELECT Statements & Filtering Data
• Aggregations: COUNT, SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX
• GROUP BY & HAVING Clauses
• Joins: INNER, LEFT, RIGHT, FULL
• Subqueries & Common Table Expressions (CTEs)
• SQL Case Study: Data Insights
• Hands-On Practice (Query datasets to extract insights, Perform joins, aggregations, and subqueries)

curriculum.title: Module 5 - Machine Learning Basics for Analytics
curriculum.content:
• Introduction to Machine Learning: Supervised & Unsupervised
• Regression: Linear, Decision Tree, Random Forest
• Classification: Logistic, Decision Tree, Random Forest
• Unsupervised Learning: K-Means Clustering
• Hands-On Practice (Build and evaluate regression & classification models, Explore clustering)
• Case Study: Customer dataset analysis

curriculum.title: Module 6 - R Programming & Analytics
curriculum.content:
• R Setup & Basics: Install R & RStudio, R Console, R Markdown
• Core Syntax: variables, vectors, lists, matrices, data frames, factors
• Functions, control structures, and package management
• Data Analysis & EDA in R
• Data Visualization: interactive visuals with Plotly, ggplot2
• Machine Learning with R: linear/logistic regression, decision trees, random forest, model evaluation (train/test split, confusion matrix, RMSE)
• Hands-On Practice (Create interactive Plotly and ggplot2 charts, Train and evaluate at least one regression and one classification model in R)

curriculum.title: Module 7 - Data Storytelling & Power BI
curriculum.content:
• Data Storytelling Framework: Findings → Impact → Recommendation
• Power BI: Connecting Data, Models & Visualizations
• Interactive Dashboards: Filters, Slicers & Drill-Through Techniques
• DAX Basics for Calculations
• Portfolio Preparation: Showcasing Projects
• Career Launchpad: Resume Building & Interview Preparation
• Hands-On Practice (Build interactive dashboards, Prepare story-driven visualizations for portfolio)

curriculum.title: Module 8 - Capstone Projects
curriculum.content:
• SQL Project: Data Insights Dashboard
• R Project: Exploratory Data Analysis & Visualization with ggplot2/plotly
• Power BI Project: Interactive Sales Dashboard
• Hands-On Practice (Implement full workflow from dataset to insights, Showcase projects in portfolio-ready format)

inclusions: Job search guidance & mock interview prep
requirements: No prior experience in data science is needed
Basic computer skills and internet access
Willingness to learn and solve real-world problems
Curiosity and consistency — that's all you really need!
Stable internet connection for accessing course content
Basic familiarity with using the terminal/command line (helpful but not required)
